reporting_fire.instruction: Generate a maritime radio chatter. A vessel makes a distress call and reports a fire.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: three eight degrees three seven minutes North, one degrees three two point one five minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is cargo vessel COSCO KAOHSIUNG. I am located at three eight degrees three seven minutes North, one degrees three two point one five minutes East, five nautical miles south east of Isla de Formentera. I am on fire. Requesting fire fighting assistance immediately. Over.
COSCO KAOHSIUNG, this is Coast Guard. Can you please provide information about the extent and the location of the fire? Over.
Coast Guard, fire is on the deck. For now, we could keep the fire contained, but we failed to extinguish it. However, we have explosive cargo onboard. Fire might reach them if it is out of control. Over.
Are there any injuries or dead persons? Over.
No injuries or fatalities are reported. Over.
Understood. We have alerted the nearby vessels and a helicopter is en route to your location. ETA three zero minutes. We will also dispatch a fire fighter boat. Try to keep the fire contained as long as you can. Standby for further assistance and keep us updated. Over.
Thank you Coast Guard. Over.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: eighty degrees North, thirty-one degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel SEAFORTH COMET. I have a fire on board and require immediate assistance. My position is eighty degrees North, thirty-one degrees East, on the Queen Victoria Sea, thirteen nautical miles north west of Kvitøya. Over.
SEAFORTH COMET, this is Coast Guard. Can you give us more information about the fire? What are your current conditions? Over.
The fire is in our galley and is spreading to the crew quarters. We are experiencing heavy smoke and heat. We are trying to evacuate the area, but it is getting difficult. We need breathing apparatus and fire pumps. Over.
We have alerted nearby vessels and are dispatching a rescue team with fire fighting equipment to your location. Can you tell us if you have any injuries on board? Over.
We have two crew members with minor injuries, but they are stable. Over.
Understood. Help is on the way. ETA is one hour. Please keep us updated on your situation. Over.
Thank you for your assistance. We will keep you updated. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: six three six zero two two eight seven five
input.vessel_call_sign: five Lima Kilo Victor seven
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: fifty-four degrees North, fifty-six degrees West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is four seven seven one three six eight zero zero cargo vessel MSC ATHOS, call sign five Lima Kilo Victor seven, located at the position fifty-four degrees North, fifty-six degrees West, on the Labrador Sea, fifteen nautical miles north west of the Outer Gannet Island. I have suffered a major fire in the cargo hold. Requesting fire pumps immediately.
MSC ATHOS, this is Coast Guard. We read you loud and clear. Can you give more details on the extent of the fire and the status of the crew?
Fire is spreading quickly. We have fifteen crew members on board and we're trying to evacuate as many as possible. One crew member is critically injured. We are experiencing some difficulty with the fire suppression system.
Are there any dangerous goods on the cargo hold?
We have a cargo of lithium-ion batteries, approximately five hundred units, and a cargo of corrosive chemicals, approximately one thousand liters.
Help is on the way. ETA is two hours. Try to keep the fire contained as much as you can and stay in this channel for further instructions and updates.
Understood, I appreciate the assistance.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: eleven degrees South, one hundred thirty-one degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is cargo vessel ATLAS LEADER, We have a fire on the bridge, we could not control it and it is spreading quickly to the superstructure. We have sixteen crew members on board. Our position is eleven degrees South, one hundred thirty-one degrees East. Just twenty nautical miles north east of Irrititu Island. We intend to leave the vessel. I repeat we intend to leave the vessel. Requesting assistance with evacuation immediately. Over.
ATLAS LEADER, this is Coast Guard. Can you confirm if the other crew members are accounted for? Over.
Yes, Coast Guard. We are preparing the life boats and put on the life jackets already. Over.
Roger that. Stay calm, follow the emergency procedures and activate your Emergency Position-Indicating Radio Beacon. Stay on this channel for further communication. A rescue team with medical personnel is on its way. ETA is one hour. We also dispatched a fire fighting vessel to your location. Stay safe. Over.
Understood. Thank you, sir. Please hurry. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: three three eight zero seven three one nine one
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: zero degrees nine minutes North, one two one degrees one three decimal one six minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is pleasure craft THOR, MMSI number three three eight zero seven three one nine one. I am located at zero degrees nine minutes North, one two one degrees one three decimal one six minutes East, about six nautical miles off Pulau Panabean. We have had a tragic incident. There is a fire in the engine room due to an explosion, port side, One crew member lost his life unfortunately and two more are injured. It is spreading quickly and we are having trouble containing it.
THOR, this is Coast Guard. We read you loud and clear. I am so sorry to hear about the loss of life. Can you provide more information on the condition of the injured crew members?
They are in critical condition. We have nine crew members onboard. Including the two injured and the one who did not make it. We are in danger of losing power and control of the vessel.
Roger that, THOR. We're dispatching a rescue vessel immediately. Can you give us your estimated time of arrival at the nearest port?
I think it'll take us about five hours to reach the nearest port, we are two five nautical miles away from it, but we are running low on power and may not make it. The injured crew members are in need of medical attention ASAP.
Understood. We're sending a fire fighting boat to assist you. ETA is two hours. Can you confirm your life rafts are ready and your crew is prepared for evacuation? We will also send a medical team to assist with the injured crew members.
Affirmative, Coast Guard. Our life rafts are ready and our crew is preparing for evacuation. We will do our best to keep the fire contained until help arrives.
Roger that. Stay calm and stay in the channel for further instructions. Also keep us updated.
Understood, please hurry.

input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Delta Juliet eight eight two seven
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seven degrees four nine decimal eight eight minutes North, one four three degrees five eight minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is sailing vessel SEABORNE, call sign Whisky Delta Juliet eight eight two seven. I am on fire at position seven degrees four nine decimal eight eight minutes North, one four three degrees five eight minutes East, north east of Woleai. Fire is in the engine room, and we are experiencing loss of propulsion. We have two zero crew members on board, and two are injured. We require immediate assistance for firefighting and medical aid.
This is Coast Guard. We read you loud and clear. We are dispatching a rescue team to your location. Can you provide more information about the fire and your current situation?
Fire is spreading and we are experiencing intense heat. We are trying to contain the fire with our onboard systems, but we need additional support. Our injured crew members require medical attention as soon as possible.
SEABORNE, we have an ETA of three hours to your location. We will be bringing a firefighting team and medical personnel. Can you confirm if you can hold on until we arrive?
We are trying our best to contain the fire, but the situation is getting worse. We will hold on as long as we can. Please hurry.
We are doing our best to reach you as soon as possible. Hold on, help is on the way.
We are grateful for your assistance. We will keep fighting the fire until you arrive.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seventy degrees five one decimal zero six minutes North, one hundred forty-six degrees three zero decimal seven two minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is tanker VIVIT ALTAIS. I am on fire, location seventy degrees five one decimal zero six minutes North, one hundred forty-six degrees three zero decimal seven two minutes West, thirty-four nautical miles north east of the Narwhal Island, in the Beaufort Sea. Fire is on the cargo hold. We require immediate assistance. Over.
This is Coast Guard, responding to your distress call. State the number of persons on board. Over.
We have twenty crew members on board. Fire is spreading to the upper deck. We need firefighting assistance and possibly evacuation. Over.
Roger that. We are dispatching a rescue team to your location. ETA is approximately two hours. Can you confirm if you have any injuries on board?
We have two crew members with minor injuries. We are trying to ventilate the cargo hold, but the fire is producing toxic fumes. We need help ASAP. Over.
Understood. We are sending a helicopter with a hazmat team and a rescue boat. Can you prepare for possible evacuation? Over.
Roger that. We are preparing for evacuation. Fire is getting closer to the accommodation block. We need to act fast. Over.
Help is on the way. Keep us updated on your situation. Over.
Fire is now spreading to the upper decks. We are experiencing reduced visibility due to smoke. Please hurry. Over.
Roger that. We are almost there. Hold on. Over.
What is the ETA? It is getting worse. Over.
This is Coast Guard. Can you hear us? Respond if you can. Over.

input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Delta Juliet three three six three
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: four eight degrees five four minutes South, seven six degrees four eight point five eight minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is passenger vessel MICHAEL W BEHRENS, call sign Whisky Delta Juliet three three six three. We have a fire in the cargo hold. My position is four eight degrees five four minutes South, seven six degrees four eight point five eight minutes West, four five nautical miles off the coast of Islote Western. The fire was caused by a welding accident during maintenance work. We require immediate assistance. Over.
This is Coast Guard. What is the extent of the fire and how many passengers and crew members are on board? Over.
The fire is spreading to the adjacent cargo holds, we have three crew members injured, and a total of two zero zero passengers and one zero five crew members on board. We are trying to contain the fire, but it is getting out of control. We need fire fighting assistance and medical aid as soon as possible. Over.
Roger that. We have a patrol boat en route to your position, ETA approximately two zero minutes. Can you tell me if you have enough life rafts and emergency beacons for all on board, and if you are preparing to evacuate the passengers? Over.
We have enough life rafts, but we are having trouble accessing the emergency beacons due to the fire. We are preparing to evacuate the passengers to the upper decks, but we need help to get them to safety. Over.
Roger that. The patrol boat will have a fire fighting team, medical personnel and a rescue boat on board. We will also dispatch a helicopter to assist with the evacuation. Can you give me an update on the fire's progress and your current situation? Over.
The fire is spreading fast, we are losing power, and the crew is getting exhausted. We are trying to hold on, but we need help ASAP. The passengers are getting anxious, and we need to get them to safety soon. Over.
Hold on. Help is on the way. The patrol boat is ten minutes from your position. Over.

input.vessel_call_sign: Delta five Oscar Tango eight
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seventy-nine degrees North, seventy-six degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel CAESAR, call sign Delta five Oscar Tango eight. We are located at seventy-nine degrees North, seventy-six degrees East, south east of Ostrov Vize. We have a fire in the boiler room. The fire is spreading rapidly, and we require immediate assistance. We have twenty crew members on board, and five are injured. We are trying to contain the fire, but it is getting out of control. We need fire fighting assistance and medical aid as soon as possible. Over.
CAESAR, this is Coast Guard. We received your distress call. Can you state the extent of the injuries to your crew members? Over.
The injured crew members have severe burns and smoke inhalation. We are doing our best to treat them, but they need immediate medical attention. The fire is getting worse, and we are experiencing difficulty breathing due to the toxic fumes. We need help now. Over.
CAESAR, we have dispatched a rescue team, including a fire fighting vessel and a helicopter with a medical team. ETA is approximately two hours. In the meantime, can you activate your EPIRB and try to contain the fire as much as possible? We also recommend that you prepare your crew for evacuation. Over.
We have activated our EPIRB, and we are trying to contain the fire. However, it is getting increasingly difficult. The smoke is getting thicker and we can barely see. We are preparing the crew for evacuation, but we need guidance on the best course of action. Over.
We are monitoring your situation closely. We recommend that you try to keep your crew as far away from the fire as possible and wait for the rescue team to arrive. If the situation becomes unbearable, we will guide you through the evacuation procedure. Just hang in there, help is on the way. Over.
We will try to hold on. Thank you. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: two one nine zero two eight three four five
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seventy-nine degrees ten minutes North, forty-seven degrees five three decimal five six minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is two one nine zero two eight three four five, motor vessel SILVER FOX. We have a fire on board, location is engine room, port side. Our position is seventy-nine degrees ten minutes North, forty-seven degrees five three decimal five six minutes East. We require immediate assistance. Over.
This is Coast Guard. Are there any injuries reported? Over.
We have two crew members injured. Fire is spreading rapidly. Over.
Roger that, SILVER FOX. We have dispatched a rescue boat and a helicopter to your location. ETA is approximately thirty minutes. Can you tell me the status of your firefighting efforts? Over.
We are using all available resources to fight the fire, but it is getting out of control. We need additional firefighting assistance and medical aid for our injured crew members. Over.
Our rescue boat will be equipped with firefighting gear and medical personnel. We recommend you prepare for evacuation of the injured crew members. Over.
We are preparing for evacuation. Fire is now spreading to the bridge. We have just had an explosion in the engine room. The fire is now out of control. We are taking on water. Over.
We are expediting the rescue effort. Can you estimate how long you can keep the vessel afloat and confirm if all crew members are acoounted for? Over.
I am not sure. The damage is extensive. We are trying to keep the pumps running, but we are going to need to abandon the vessel soon. Over.
Roger that, SILVER FOX. Our helicopter is on scene now. We will begin evacuating the crew immediately. We will also deploy a life raft to assist with evacuation. Over.
We see the helicopter. We are abandoning the vessel now. Over.

reporting_flooding.instruction: Generate a maritime radio chatter. A vessel makes a distress call and reports flooding.

input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Delta India eight one two four
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: four nine degrees North, one five five degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is pleasure craft AMBROSIA, Whisky Delta India eight one two four. I am at four nine degrees North, one five five degrees East. I am experiencing severe flooding below water line.
AMBROSIA, this is Coast Guard. What assistance do you require?
Coast Guard, we require pumps and medical assistance. Flooding is out of control. We have dangerous list to port side.
Sending pumps and arranging for helicopter with medical team. ETA within two hours.
Understood. We will prepare for helicopter transfer. Please advise on further actions.
Prepare for evacuation if flooding worsens. How many injured persons are there on board?
Two. We are preparing to abandon vessel if necessary.
Ensure EPIRB is switched on. Assistance is on the way.

input.vessel_MMSI: three one six zero four zero two nine two
input.vessel_call_sign: Victor Yankee two two zero zero
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seven one degrees three five minutes North, one six one degrees two four decimal one two minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is three one six zero four zero two nine two motor vessel SUNSHINE, call sign Victor Yankee two two zero zero. I am flooding. Position seven one degrees three five minutes North, one six one degrees two four decimal one two minutes East, East Siberian Sea. I require immediate assistance. Over.
SUNSHINE, this is Coast Guard. What is the extent of the flooding? Over.
Coast Guard, flooding is below the water line, we cannot control it. We require pumps urgently. Over.
SUNSHINE, understood. We will send pumps and a helicopter with a rescue team. ETA approximately two hours. Over.
Understood, Coast Guard. Crew is preparing lifeboats for possible evacuation. We have thirty two people onboard. Over.
SUNSHINE, understood. Please keep us updated on the situation. Stand by for further instructions. Over.

input.vessel_call_sign: Delta Bravo Victor Echo
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: one six degrees four minutes North, six three degrees five one minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is anti-pollution vessel STRELASUND, Delta Bravo Victor Echo. Position one six degrees four minutes North, six three degrees five one minutes West. We are flooding below waterline. Cannot control flooding. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
STRELASUND, this is Coast Guard. Roger your Mayday. What is your situation? Over.
We have a breach in the hull after hitting submerged object. Taking on water rapidly. Crew is pumping but flooding continues. Over.
Understood. How many persons on board? Any injuries? Over.
One eight persons on board. Three injured. We require medical assistance. Over.
Roger. Dispatching rescue vessel and helicopter to your position. ETA one five minutes. Will you abandon vessel? Over.
We may need to abandon if the flooding worsens. EPIRB is activated. Over.
Stay calm. Assistance is en route. Notify us if you start the evacuation. Over.

input.vessel_call_sign: Delta five Juliet Lima six
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: three zero degrees North, one four zero degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is cargo vessel DAYTONA BEACH, call sign Delta five Juliet Lima six. Position three zero degrees North, one four zero degrees East. We have a breach in the engine room and are flooding rapidly. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
This is Coast Guard. What is the extent of the flooding? Over.
Flooding is uncontrollable. Two crew members are trapped below deck. We require divers and medical assistance. Over.
Understood. We are dispatching rescue vessels and a helicopter to your position. ETA one hour. Do you need to abandon vessel? Over.
Coast Guard, we are attempting to contain flooding. Preparing lifeboats in case evacuation is necessary. Over.
DAYTONA BEACH, do you have any dangerous cargo on board? Over.
Affirmative, Coast Guard. We are carrying chemicals in the cargo hold. Risk of contamination if submerged. Over.
We will send an anti-pollution vessel and a team for possible salvage operation. Stand by for further instructions. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: three six seven one eight zero seven nine zero
input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Delta Mike eight eight three two
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: twenty-one degrees twenty-two minutes North, eighty-three degrees fifty-four point eight nine minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is towing vessel THUBAN. My MMSI number is three six seven one eight zero seven nine zero. My call sign is Whisky Delta Mike eight eight three two. My position is twenty-one degrees twenty-two minutes North, eighty-three degrees fifty-four point eight nine minutes West, thirty two nautical miles south east of Cabo Francés. I am flooding below waterline and cannot control the flooding. We require immediate assistance.
This is Coast Guard. We have received your Mayday. What is the cause of the flooding?
We struck a submerged object, resulting in a hull breach. We have a dangerous list to starboard and are taking on water rapidly.
Understood. Are there any injuries on board?
Coast Guard, we have two injured crew members requiring medical assistance.
We are dispatching a rescue vessel and a helicopter with medical personnel. ETA is within one hour. Are you making any preparation to abandon the vessel?
Yes, we are preparing to abandon vessel. We will launch lifeboats.
How many persons will abandon vessel?
All twenty persons will abandon vessel.
Understood. Stand by. Assistance is on the way.

input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Yankee six three three two
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: twenty-two degrees North, seventy degrees West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel AURORA IV, Whisky Yankee six three three two. My position is twenty-two degrees North, seventy degrees West, thirty-eight nautical miles north east of The Pillory. I am taking on water after hitting a submerged object. Flooding is increasing rapidly. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
AURORA IV, this is Coast Guard. What is the extent of flooding and number of persons on board? Over.
Engine room is flooded, pumps cannot control the flooding. We have sixteen persons on board. Two crew members are injured, one with a broken arm, one unconscious. Require medical assistance. Over.
Understood AURORA IV. Stand by, we are dispatching a helicopter with a medic. ETA forty-five minutes. Inform us if you are abandoning the vessel. Over.
We are preparing lifeboats but will remain on board as long as possible. Will update if abandonment is necessary. Over.
Maintain communications and update on situation. A rescue vessel is also en route from Cockburn Harbour, ETA one hour. Over.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seventy-one degrees two two point two minutes North, six degrees five two point seven eight minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel NANA. We are at seventy-one degrees twenty-two point two minutes North, six degrees fifty-two point seven eight minutes West, north east of Nordkapp. I am experiencing severe flooding due to a breach. We require immediate assistance. Over.
Motor vessel NANA, this is Coast Guard. How many persons are on board and are there any injuries reported? Over.
Coast Guard, we have eighteen persons on board. No injuries reported, but situation is critical. Water level rising fast. Over.
Understood. We are dispatching a rescue helicopter to your position. ETA is forty minutes. Stand by for further instructions. Over.
Roger. We are preparing lifeboats for a possible evacuation. Attempting to contain flooding with emergency pumps. Over.
A boat is also on the way to assist with water removal. ETA is fifty minutes. Keep us informed of any changes. Over.
Thanks Coast Guard. Lifeboats are ready for immediate deployment if required. I will inform you if we abandon the vessel. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: four seven seven nine five nine two zero zero
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: sixty degrees North, five degrees West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is cargo vessel COSCO THAILAND, MMSI four seven seven nine five nine two zero zero. Our position is sixty degrees North, five degrees West, forty-seven nautical miles south east of Akraberg. We have heavy flooding in the engine room due to ruptured ballast tank. Flooding is out of control. I request immediate assistance. Over.
COSCO THAILAND, this is Coast Guard responding. What is the extent of the flooding? Is the vessel stable? Over.
 Flooding has reached main engine compartment. Pumps are running but not keeping up. Vessel is listing to the starboard side. Over.
How many persons on board? Any injuries? Over.
We have twenty-two persons on board. No injuries reported. Preparing liferafts in case of emergency abandonment. Over.
A rescue vessel is departing from Port of Skopun, ETA one hour. Helicopter also en route. Activate EPIRB if not already done. Over.
EPIRB is switched on. Over.
COSCO THAILAND, do you have any hazardous cargo onboard? Over.
Coast Guard, we do not have any hazardous materials onboard. Over.
Understood. Keep calm and report any changes in the situation. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: two one nine one five nine zero zero zero
input.vessel_call_sign: Oscar Yankee Victor Alfa two
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: fifteen degrees North, one hundred eleven degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is tugboat FENJA, MMSI two one nine one five nine zero zero zero, call sign Oscar Yankee Victor Alfa two. My position is fifteen degrees North, one hundred eleven degrees East, on South China Sea, twelve nautical miles north east of Triton Island. Flooding in stern compartment due to hull breach. Pumps are struggling to keep up. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
FENJA, this is Coast Guard station. State the number of persons on board and if there are any casualties. Over.
Coast Guard, we have twenty-two persons on board. Three crew members trapped in lower deck, attempting rescue. Structural integrity uncertain. Over.
Roger that. Deploying rescue helicopter, ETA eighty minutes. Rescue vessel also en route, ETA four hours. Can you maintain position? Over.
Vessel is holding but stern is sinking lower. Preparing emergency ballast adjustments to stabilize. Over.
Understood. Confirm if EPIRB is activated and if you require additional medical assistance. Over.
EPIRB activated. Medical assistance may be required if trapped crew is not freed soon. We are cutting through bulkhead. Over.
Stay on this frequency and update us on crew rescue efforts. Over.

input.vessel_MMSI: three six eight one seven six five nine zero
input.vessel_call_sign: Whisky Delta Lima nine one six eight
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: seventy-nine degrees five minutes North, one hundred seven degrees thirty-one minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is three six eight one seven six five nine zero sailing vessel DAEDALUS, Whisky Delta Lima nine one six eight. We are experiencing severe flooding at seventy-nine degrees five minutes North, one hundred seven degrees thirty-one minutes East, on the Laptev Sea north east Ostrov Morskoy. The cause is collision with a drifting container. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
DAEDALUS, this is Coast Guard. Can you give more information about the extent of the flooding? Over.
We have flooding in the engine room, affecting propulsion. I am not under command. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
Understood, DAEDALUS. What is the number of persons on board? Over.
Twenty. Over.
Coast Guard, we are dispatching a Coast Guard vessel to your position. ETA approximately two hours. Prepare for possible evacuation. Over.
Roger, Coast Guard. We are preparing lifeboats. Standing by for further instructions. Over.
Maintain current position if possible. Assistance is on the way. Over.

reporting_collision.instruction: Generate a maritime radio chatter. A vessel makes a distress call and reports collision.

input.vessel_MMSI: three three eight three nine two six five one
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: one eight degrees two nine minutes South, one four six degrees four one minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is three three eight three nine two six five one sailing vessel CAYENNE. I have collided with the pleasure craft KNOTTY DOGS. Our position is one eight degrees two nine minutes South, one four six degrees four one minutes East. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
CAYENNE, this is Coast Guard. We copy your Mayday. Please report the extent of the damage and your current status. Over.
We have significant damage below the waterline, and our vessel is taking on water. We are not under command. Over.
We are dispatching a rescue team including a tug and medical personnel from Dungeness Harbour, ETA two zero minutes. Can you provide any further details or immediate needs? Over.
We have a crew of four and we are attempting temporary repairs but require urgent evacuation. Cargo hold is secure but we have perishable goods onboard. Over.
Understood, CAYENNE. Assistance is on the way. Maintain your current position if safe to do so. We will keep you updated on the rescue operation. Over.
Thank you, Coast Guard. We will await your arrival. Over.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: eighty degrees North, ninety-two degrees East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel IRISHWAKE at eighty degrees North, ninety-two degrees East. I have collided with the pleasure craft DIFFERENT VIEWS.
This is Coast Guard. Please report the damage.
We have sustained damage below the waterline and are taking on water slowly. Cargo hold is affected.
Understood. What assistance do you require?
I need immediate tug assistance and medical support for minor injuries on board.
Tug is en route. ETA is approximately one hour. Helicopter with medical team will reach you in thirty minutes. Please stay on this channel for updates.
We are implementing damage control measures and proceeding at reduced speed to maintain stability.
Motor vessel IRISHWAKE, please keep us informed of any changes in your situation.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: five three degrees North, one one degrees West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is tanker BW BOSTON. Position five three degrees North, one one degrees West, three eight nautical miles south west of Slyne Head. We have collided with uncharted underwater rocks. Taking on water in cargo hold. Requesting immediate assistance. Over.
BW BOSTON, this is Coast Guard. How many people on board? Over.
Two zero members onboard. We are listing to port side. Initiating pumps but flooding continues. Over.
Understood. ETA of first rescue helicopter is approximately three zero minutes. Rescue vessels and additional assistance en route from Bofin Harbour, ETA four zero minutes. Over.
Preparing crew for evacuation. Water level is rising and situation is critical. Over.
BW Boston, keep calm. Over.
We are ready for evacuation. Crew assembled on deck. Thank you for support. Over.

input.vessel_coordinate_dms: nineteen degrees fifty-two minutes North, one hundred sixty-six degrees three seven decimal two eight minutes East

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is passenger vessel BEATRIX. I had collision with an unknown submerged object. Our position is nineteen degrees fifty-two minutes North, one hundred sixty-six degrees three seven decimal two eight minutes East. We are taking on water. Immediate assistance required.
BEATRIX, this is Coast Guard. Can you confirm if there are any injuries and the extent of the flooding?
No injuries reported. Water inflow is significant in the forward hold. Pumps are operational but struggling to keep up. Requesting immediate assistance.
We are dispatching a rescue vessel with additional pumps and a team to assist. ETA approximately thirty minutes. A patrol vessel with will arrive in forty-five minutes. Can you maintain your current position?
We are maintaining position.
Understood, BEATRIX. Help is en route. Hold tight.

input.vessel_call_sign: Delta Bravo nine nine five four
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: one six degrees three one decimal four minutes South, one three nine degrees one minutes West

output:
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is motor vessel TUGIDAK, call sign Delta Bravo nine nine five four. Position one six degrees three one decimal four minutes South, one three nine degrees one minutes West, five nine nautical miles north west of Tumuruku. I have collided with a large floating object. Damage is above the waterline, but we have significant structural damage. Requesting immediate assistance.
This is Coast Guard. Are you in any imminent danger?
Negative. We are attempting temporary repairs to prevent further damage, but we need evacuation support.
We are dispatching a rescue helicopter to your location. ETA approximately two zero minutes. Prepare for possible evacuation.
Understood, Coast Guard. We are preparing for helicopter evacuation and securing the damaged area.
Stay safe TUGIDAK. We will maintain communication.

input.vessel_call_sign: Bravo India Bravo Delta three
input.vessel_coordinate_dms: four three degrees South, one seven eight degrees West
